sen.j: 延久蝦夷合戦（えんきゅうえぞかっせん）は平安時代の戦役。
sen.e: Enkyu Ezo War is the major warfare occurred in Heian period.
Enkyu Ezo War was the major warfare occurred in the Heian period.
Enkyu Ezo War was the major warfare occurred in the Heian period.

sen.j: 延久二年合戦、延久合戦とも言う。
sen.e: It is also called Eikyu Two-year War or Eikyu War.
It is also called Eikyu Two-year War or Eikyu War.
It is also called Eikyu Two-year War or Eikyu War.

sen.j: 西暦1069年から1074年までの延久年間に、陸奥守源頼俊が清原貞衡（清原真衡と同一人物との有力説がある）と共に兵を率い蝦夷を攻略したとされる戦い。
sen.e: It is the war against Ezo/Emishi (the generic name of the native people living in the north part of Japan) by the troops led by MINAMOTO no Yoritoshi, the chief official of Mutsu Province, and KIYOHARA no Sadahira. ("清原貞衡" Studies suggest this Sadahira is the same person with "清原真衡")
sen.cmt: 括弧内の説明は、漢字表記に関する説明でしたので、漢字を入れて説明しないと英文では意味を成さないため、漢字を入れそのように説明しています。
sen.e: It is the war against Ezo/Emishi (the generic name of the native people living in the north part of Japan) by the troops led by MINAMOTO no Yoritoshi, the chief official of Mutsu Province, and KIYOHARA no Sadahira. ("清原貞衡" Studies suggest this Sadahira is the same person with "清原真衡")

It is the war against Ezo/Emishi (the generic name of the native people living in the north part of Japan) by the troops led by MINAMOTO no Yoritoshi, the goovernor of Mutsu Province, and KIYOHARA no Sadahira ("清原貞衡" Studies suggest this Sadahira is the same person with "清原真衡") during the Eikyu era from 1069 to 1074.
sen.cmt: 「西暦1069年から1074年までの延久年間に」 訳漏れ対応しました。chief official→governor

sen.j: 後三条天皇は即位後、延久新政とも言われる政治改革を断行した。
sen.e: Gosanjo Emperor carried out a political reformation called Eikyu Shinsei after the enthronement. (The New Rule of Eikyu)
Gosanjo Emperor carried out a political reformation called Eikyu Shinsei after the enthronement (The New Rule of Eikyu).
Emperor Gosanjo carried out a political reformation called Eikyu Shinsei (The New Rule of Eikyu) after the enthronement.
sen.cmt: Gosanjo Emperor→Emperor Gosanjo(The New Rule of Eikyu) の位置を変更

sen.j: 後三条天皇は桓武天皇を意識し、大内裏の再建と征夷の完遂を政策として打ち立てる。
sen.e: Gosanjo Emperor tried to follow the ruling of Kanmu Emperor, and he formulated various policies, to finalize the reconstruction of Imperial Palace, and the subjugation of Ezo. (Emishi)
Gosanjo Emperor tried to follow the ruling of Kanmu Emperor, and he formulated various policies, to finalize the reconstruction of Imperial Palace, and the subjugation of Ezo (Emishi).
Emperor Gosanjo tried to follow the ruling of Emperor Kanmu, and he formulated various policies, to finalize the reconstruction of Imperial Palace, and the subjugation of Ezo (Emishi).

sen.j: これを請け、陸奥守源頼俊は延久2年（1070年）に軍を編成し、国府を発ち、北上する。
sen.e: Upon the Imperial order of Gosanjo Emperor, the chief official of Mutsu Province MINAMOTO no Yoritoshi organized a troops in 1070, and left the provincial capital of Mutsu going up to the north.
Upon the Imperial order of Gosanjo Emperor, the chief official of Mutsu Province MINAMOTO no Yoritoshi organized troops in 1070, and left the provincial capital of Mutsu going up to the north.
Upon the Imperial order of Emperor Gosanjo, the governor of Mutsu Province MINAMOTO no Yoritoshi organized troops in 1070, and left the provincial capital of Mutsu going up to the north.

sen.j: 遠征途上、藤原基通 (散位)が国司の印と国正倉の鍵を奪い逃走する事件が発生する。
sen.e: During the course of this expedition, FUJIWARA no Motomichi (He was Sanni who has a court rank but not appointed to any government post) seized and run off with the seal of the provincial official and the key of the provincial storage. (the proof of the authenticity of the provincial official status)

During the course of this expedition, FUJIWARA no Motomichi (He was Sanni who has a court rank but not appointed to any government post) seized and ran off with the seal of the provincial official and the key of the provincial storage (the proof of the authenticity of the provincial official status).

During the course of this expedition, FUJIWARA no Motomichi (Sani [courtier without post]) seized and ran off with the seal of the provincial official and the key of the provincial storage (the proof of the authenticity of the provincial official status).

sen.j: 都に下野国守源義家から、基通が印と鍵を持参して投降して来たので逮捕したとの報がはいる。
sen.e: The provincial official of Simotsuke Province, MINAMOTO no Yoshiie, notified the Imperial Court that Motomichi surrendered to him along with the seal and the key of the provincial official.
The provincial official of Shimotsuke Province, MINAMOTO no Yoshiie, notified the Imperial Court that Motomichi surrendered to him along with the seal and the key of the provincial official.
The governor of Shimotsuke Province, MINAMOTO no Yoshiie, notified the Imperial Court that Motomichi surrendered to him along with the seal and the key of the provincial official.

sen.j: 朝廷は同年8月1日に頼俊を召還する宣旨を発した。
sen.e: The Imperial Court issued a rescript to summon Yoritoshi on August 1 of the same year.
The Imperial Court issued a rescript to summon Yoritoshi on August 1 of the same year.
The Imperial Court issued a rescript to summon Yoritoshi on September 14 of the same year.

sen.j: 同年12月26日付けで頼俊から朝廷へ大戦果を挙げたとの弁明が届く。
sen.e: Yoritoshi forwarded a report to the Imperial Court dated on December 26 of the same year, that his troops had achieved a great victory in Ezo.
Yoritoshi forwarded a report to the Imperial Court dated on December 26 of the same year, that his troops had achieved a great victory in Ezo.
Yoritoshi forwarded a report to the Imperial Court dated on February 4 of the next year, that his troops had achieved a great victory in Ezo.

sen.j: 翌年5月5日、朝廷は頼俊に陸奥での謹慎を言い渡した。
sen.e: On May 5 of the next year, the Imperial Court ordered Yoritoshi to refrain from leaving Mutsu Province.
On May 5 of the next year, the Imperial Court ordered Yoritoshi to refrain from leaving Mutsu Province.
On June 11 of the same year, the Imperial Court ordered Yoritoshi to refrain from leaving Mutsu Province.

sen.j: 戦後の論功として、清原貞衡は鎮守府将軍に任ぜられたが、源頼俊に対する行賞は何もなかった。
sen.e: Although KIYOHARA no Sadahira was granted a reward to be appointed as Chinjyufu Shogun (Commander-in-Chief of the Defence of the North) for the victory, MINAMOTO no Yoritoshi did not receive any reward.

Although KIYOHARA no Sadahira was granted a reward to be appointed as Chinjufu Shogun (Commander-in-Chief of the Defence of the North) for the victory, MINAMOTO no Yoritoshi did not receive any reward.

Although KIYOHARA no Sadahira was granted a reward to be appointed as Chinjufu Shogun (Commander-in-Chief of the Defence of the North) for the victory, MINAMOTO no Yoritoshi did not receive any reward.

sen.j: 合戦に対する評価は二分している。
sen.e: The evaluations regarding the consequence of this war are divided into two.
The evaluations regarding the consequence of this war are divided into two.
The evaluations regarding the consequence of this war are divided into two.

sen.j: 一つ目は、頼俊の遠征はその主張のように大成功し、津軽半島と下北半島までの本州全土を朝廷の支配下に置いたとするものである。
sen.e: The first theory is that the expedition of Yoritoshi was actually ended as a great success as he insisted, by conquering the regions from Tsugaru Peninsula to Shimokita Peninsula and expanded the ruling of the Imperial Court throughout the Honshu Island.

The first theory is that the expedition of Yoritoshi actually ended as a great success as he insisted, by conquering the regions from Tsugaru Peninsula to Shimokita Peninsula and expanding the ruling of the Imperial Court throughout the Honshu Island.

The first theory is that the expedition of Yoritoshi actually ended as a great success as he insisted, by conquering the regions from Tsugaru Peninsula to Shimokita Peninsula and expanding the ruling of the Imperial Court throughout the Honshu Island.

sen.j: 遠征軍の主力が出羽清原氏によると見られることから、実質上の総大将は清原貞衡で、源頼俊の失脚はそれほど影響が無かったと見る。
sen.e: In this theory, the main force of the expedition troops was assumed to be the group led by KIYOHARA clan of Dewa Province, therefore the downfall of MINAMOTO no Yoritoshi did not affect the course of this war.

In this theory, the main force of the expedition troops was assumed to be the group led by KIYOHARA clan of Dewa Province, therefore the downfall of MINAMOTO no Yoritoshi did not affect the course of this war.

In this theory, the main force of the expedition troops was assumed to be the group led by Kiyohara clan of Dewa Province, therefore the downfall of MINAMOTO no Yoritoshi did not affect the course of this war.

sen.j: これにより、桓武・嵯峨天皇朝以来の大遠征で、支配下に入った地域で建郡が行われ、久慈郡 (陸奥国)、糠部郡などが置かれた。
sen.e: As the result of this expedition against Ezo/Emishi operated long after the earlier expeditions promoted by Kanmu and Saga Emperors, new districts were established in the territorialized area, as Kuji District (Mutsu Province) and Nukanobe District.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: As the result of this expedition against Ezo/Emishi operated long after the earlier expeditions promoted by Kanmu and Saga Emperors, new districts were established in the territorialized area, such as Kuji District (Mutsu Province) and Nukanobe District.

As the result of this expedition against Ezo/Emishi operated long after the earlier expeditions promoted by Emperor Kanmu and Emperor Saga, new counties were established in the territorialized area, such as Kuji County (Mutsu Province) and Nukanobe County.
sen.cmt: Kanmu and Saga Emperors→Emperor Kanmu and Emperor SagaDistrict→Countydistricts→counties

sen.j: これ以降近代（江戸時代後期）に至るまで津軽海峡までが日本の北端（当時の感覚では東端）となったとする。
sen.e: After these events, the northern extremity of Japan was pushed further to the region facing to the Tsugaru Straits (which was considered to be the eastern extremity at that time) until the end of Edo period before the modern era of Japan.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処。分割前の文末は「〜なったとするもの。」となっていますが、分割後は多少不自然なため「〜なったとする。」に変更しました。
sen.e: After these events, the northern extremity of Japan was pushed further to the region facing to the Tsugaru Straits (which was considered to be the eastern extremity at that time) until the end of Edo period before the modern era of Japan.

After these events, the northern extremity of Japan was pushed further to the region facing to the Tsugaru Straits (which was considered to be the eastern extremity at that time) until the end of Edo period before the modern era of Japan.

sen.j: もうひとつは、合戦は総大将頼俊が遠征途中で失脚したため、事実上遠征は中止され、成果は中途半端に終わったとするもの。
sen.e: The other theory assumes that the expedition was called off because of the downfall of the supreme commander Yoritosi, therefore the expedition was half-finished.
The other theory assumes that the expedition was called off because of the downfall of the supreme commander Yoritoshi, therefore the expedition was half-finished.
The other theory assumes that the expedition was called off because of the downfall of the supreme commander Yoritoshi, therefore the expedition was half-finished.

sen.j: この説では冬季に行軍が困難であることや頼俊の報告は自分の不祥事の穴埋めをするための誇大報告とし、津軽半島、下北半島までが朝廷の支配下に入ったのは、その後の清原氏や奥州藤原氏によるものとする。
sen.e: This theory mentioned the awkward point of the expedition troops marching and fighting in the severe winter conditions of the northern part of Japan; it is assumed that the report of Yoritoshi to the Imperial Court stating the grand victory over Ezo was exaggerated in order to cover up his disgraceful matter of loosing the important official instruments; in reality, the conquer of Tsugaru and Shimokita Peninsula regions to be ruled under the Imperial Court was succeeded by the later expeditions operated by Kiyohara clan, or even later by the Northern Fujiwara clan.

This theory mentioned the awkward point of the expedition troops marching and fighting in the severe winter conditions of the northern part of Japan; it is assumed that the report of Yoritoshi to the Imperial Court stating the grand victory over Ezo was exaggerated in order to cover up his disgraceful matter of loosing the important official instruments; in reality, the conquest of Tsugaru and Shimokita Peninsula regions to be ruled under the Imperial Court was succeeded by the later expeditions operated by Kiyohara clan, or even later by the Northern Fujiwara clan.

This theory mentioned the awkward point of the expedition troops marching and fighting in the severe winter conditions of the northern part of Japan; it is assumed that the report of Yoritoshi to the Imperial Court stating the grand victory over Ezo was exaggerated in order to cover up his disgraceful matter of losing the important official instruments; in reality, the conquest of Tsugaru and Shimokita Peninsula regions to be ruled under the Imperial Court was succeeded by the later expeditions operated by Kiyohara clan, or even later by the Oshu Fujiwara clan.
sen.cmt: loosing→losing奥州藤原氏は用語集どおり「Oshu Fujiwara clan」としました。

sen.j: 1051年から1062年の前九年の役（奥州十二年合戦）で陸奥の安倍氏 (奥州)が滅亡し、出羽国の出羽清原氏が陸奥も支配することになった。
sen.e: As the result of Zenkunen War, (the Twelve-year War of Oshu) Abe clan of Mutsu Province (Oshu, the alternative name of Mutsu Province area) went to extinction, and Kiyohara clan of Dewa Province took control of both Dewa and Mutsu Province.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: As the result of Zenkunen War, (the Twelve-year War of Oshu) Abe clan of Mutsu Province (Oshu, the alternative name of Mutsu Province area) went to extinction, and Kiyohara clan of Dewa Province took control of both Dewa and Mutsu Province.

As the result of Zenkunen War, (the Twelve-year War of Oshu) Abe clan of Mutsu Province (Oshu, the alternative name of Mutsu Province area) went to extinction, and Kiyohara clan of Dewa Province took control of both Dewa and Mutsu Provinces.

sen.j: それと同時に、陸奥鎮守府と出羽秋田城に分かれていた東夷成敗権が鎮守府に一本化された。
sen.e: At the same time, Toiseibaiken (the right of ruling the north-eastern regions of Japan) split into two authorities as Mutsu Province Chinjyufu (the defence capital of the North) and Akita Castle of Dewa Province were integrated into Chinjyufu as a single authority.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: At the same time, Toiseibaiken (the right of ruling the north-eastern regions of Japan) split into two authorities as Mutsu Province Chinjufu (the defense capital of the North) and Akita Castle of Dewa Province were integrated into Chinjufu as a single authority.

At the same time, Toiseibaiken (the right of ruling the north-eastern regions of Japan) split into two authorities as Mutsu Province Chinjufu (the defense capital of the North) and Akita-jo Castle of Dewa Province were integrated into Chinjufu as a single authority.

sen.j: この延久蝦夷合戦では朝廷軍の主力は清原軍であったとみられる。
sen.e: The main force of the Enkyu Ezo Imperial Court expedition troops was considered to be the troops led by KIYOHARA clan.
The main force of the Enkyu Ezo Imperial Court expedition troops was considered to be the troops led by KIYOHARA clan.
The main force of the Enkyu Ezo Imperial Court expedition troops was considered to be the troops led by Kiyohara clan.

sen.j: また出兵中に陸奥国印が盗難されるという不祥事があった。
sen.e: There was a disgraceful matter during this expedition that the official seal of Mutsu Province was stolen.
There was a disgraceful matter during this expedition that the official seal of Mutsu Province was stolen.
There was a disgraceful matter during this expedition that the official seal of Mutsu Province was stolen.

sen.j: この不祥事は頼俊が陸奥に勢力を植えつけることを恐れた源義家の陰謀によるとの説がある。
sen.e: Another theory states that this matter was actually the intrigue of MINAMOTO no Yoshiie plotted against Yoriyoshi, sprung from the fear for Yoriyoshi to establish his influence in Mutsu Province.
Another theory states that this matter was actually the intrigue of MINAMOTO no Yoshiie plotted against Yoriyoshi, sprung from the fear for Yoriyoshi to establish his influence in Mutsu Province.
Another theory states that this matter was actually the intrigue of MINAMOTO no Yoshiie plotted against Yoritoshi, sprung from the fear for Yoritoshi to establish his influence in Mutsu Province.

sen.j: 結果として貞衡だけが軍功を認められ鎮守府将軍に叙せられ、奥羽における清原氏の勢力は益々盛んになった。
sen.e: As the result of this expedition, only KIYOHARA no Sadahira was rewarded for the victory by being appointed as the Chinjyufu Shogun, which strengthen the presence and influence of Kiyohara clan in Mutsu Province.

As the result of this expedition, only KIYOHARA no Sadahira was rewarded for the victory by being appointed as the Chinjufu Shogun, which strengthened the presence and influence of Kiyohara clan in Mutsu Province.

As the result of this expedition, only KIYOHARA no Sadahira was rewarded for the victory by being appointed as the Chinju-fu shogun (Commander-in-Chief of the Defense of the North), which strengthened the presence and influence of Kiyohara clan in Mutsu Province.

sen.j: しかし、この合戦での軋轢や当主真衡への一族の不満などから、前九年の役当時には一枚岩であった清原氏内部には次第に不協和音が生まれ始め、最終的には後三年の役を招いたとの評価がある。
sen.e: However, studies also suggest that although Kiyohara clan was boasting the ironclad solidarity during Zenkunen War period, the discord and frustration against the head of the clan Sadahira was developed within the clan after the Enkyu Ezo War, causing the Gosannen War that led the downfall of Kiyohara clan.

However, studies also suggest that although Kiyohara clan was boasting the ironclad solidarity during Zenkunen War period, the discord and frustration against the head of the clan Sadahira was developed within the clan after the Enkyu Ezo War, causing the Gosannen War that led the downfall of Kiyohara clan.

However, studies also suggest that although Kiyohara clan was boasting the ironclad solidarity during Zenkunen War period, the discord and frustration against the head of the clan Sadahira was developed within the clan after the Enkyu Ezo War, causing the Gosannen War that led the downfall of Kiyohara clan.

sen.j: なお、この合戦で「衣曾別嶋」まで遠征を行ったと頼俊が報告しているが、この「衣曾別嶋」が蝦夷（北海道）であるという説と本州北部であるという説、頼俊が戦果を誇大報告したという説などがある。
sen.e: The report of Yoritoshi to the Imperial Court mentioned that his troops had reached to "Ezogawa Keshima," although the location of this "Ezogawa Keshima" has not been clarified today whether "Ezogawa Keshima" was located in Ezo (Hokkaido Island) or the in the northern part of Honshu Island; it is also considered that the Yoritoshi exaggerated the military gains and other results in his report.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処。意味内容の異なる文が一文にまとめられているため、分割可能な部分で分割しました。
sen.e: The report of Yoritoshi to the Imperial Court mentioned that his troops had reached to "Ezogawa Keshima," although the location of this "Ezogawa Keshima" has not been clarified today whether "Ezogawa Keshima" was located in Ezo (Hokkaido Island) or the in the northern part of Honshu Island; it is also considered that Yoritoshi exaggerated the military gains and other results in his report.

The report of Yoritoshi to the Imperial Court mentioned that his troops had reached to 'Ezogawa Keshima,' although the location of this 'Ezogawa Keshima' has not been clarified today whether 'Ezogawa Keshima' was located in Ezo (Hokkaido Island) or the in the northern part of Honshu Island; it is also considered that Yoritoshi exaggerated the military gains and other results in his report.

sen.j: この合戦については史料は少なく、未詳な点が多くあり、まだ一般的に教科書には登場していない。
sen.e: The historical records and the evidence of this war are limited, thus there are many unclear points to be clarified before published in textbooks as a historical fact.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: The historical records and the evidence of this war are limited, thus there are many unclear points to be clarified before published in textbooks as a historical fact.
The historical records and the evidence of this war are limited, thus there are many unclear points to be clarified before published in textbooks as a historical fact.

sen.j: 今後の研究の進展が期待されている。
sen.e: It is expected the progress of the study regarding this event in the future.
Progress in the study regarding this event is expected in the future.
Progress in the study regarding this event is expected in the future.
